recipe_name: Duck stir-fry with baby corn, cashews and mangetout
author: Lesley Waters
method: Heat the oil in a wok until smoking. Add the mangetout, sweetcorn and cashew nuts and fry for 3-4 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender but retaining a bit of bite. Add the duck breast slices to the wok and stir fry for 1-2 minutes, then add the rest of the ingredients. Cook until the sauce is reduced and sticky, and the duck is cooked to your liking.  Pile the stir-fry onto a serving plate and serve.
ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil,  100g/3½oz mangetout, cut in half lengthways,  100g/3½oz baby sweetcorn, cut in half lengthways,  55g/2oz cashew nuts,  150g/5oz duck breast, thinly sliced,  1 tbsp honey,  2 tsp soy sauce,  ½ tsp freshly ground black pepper,  2 tbsp sesame seeds
